issues.description: The template declares existing attributes as public (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents) while the problem statement's UML uses '-' (private) and the solution implements all attributes as private. This visibility mismatch can confuse students about the intended encapsulation (whether attributes should be private and accessed via getters/setters) and may lead them to skip implementing getters/setters or to keep attributes public, contradicting the UML and reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the visibility of the attributes in the template to match the UML and solution: declare lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers and numberOfTutors as private. Either remove the pre-declared public fields or modify them to private so students implement getters/setters against the intended private fields and follow the encapsulation taught by the exercise.
